title: Irelia is up for a rework. Pantheon is up for a rework. Guess who isn't?

replies.body: I think Riot just has no good ideas on what to do with him.

Probably, like what can you do with him other than rework his shout? his Ulti and spin are iconic to him, and his high critrate is kinda his thing as well, its just been so long its hard to change him.

That's the same with the old Poppy, though. If Riot thinks he's problematic enough, he'll probably get a full VGU.
Although, I'm not sure if Riot thinks he's problematic enough.
He's a problem, he's just not a big enough problem, especially compared to other champions. He's infuriating, but thats mostly it.

They could change his passive with something like Jhin's in that it modifies his AA's. Make it have his auto attacks be a set speed but cleave in a large arc like he's actually swinging that huge sword he drags around.

make it a flat crit once below a certain percent, such as gains 30% crit once below 33% hp, like how poppy's armor and MR from her w doubles when shes below 40%. His ulti needs to not give him full fury and either be reduced to a 3 sec duration or make it so it cant be cast under CC. This way he still holds his status as low health fighter with a lifesaving ulti, but it makes it alot harder for him to dive you with impunity and then get out with enough hp that he can just lifesteal back up off the wave without fear of a gank.

thats just a flat nerf, a rework needs to fix problems and make them more balanced.
However there is a way they can fix it, make him deal bonus damage based on his rage, up to 50% bonus damage when he's at max rage.

Also, the playerbase keeps complaining about balancing for competitive anyway, so why buff for competitive.
Because getting RNG double crit at level 2 is a healthy experience...

"Because getting true damage and healing at level 2 is a health experience..."

See?  You can do that with anyone.

You know that will happen with Irelia

You don't know if RNGesus will give trynda a double or triple crit at level 2 when he has half a bar. It is unreliable and greatly decides the outcome of lane as to if it happens or does not happen.

I don't know if minion aggro will randomly give Irelia slightly lower health, so she gets a stun instead and can freely damage me, chunking me out, and greatly deciding the lane either.

You can do this with anyone.

You can see when a champion takes minion aggro. You can also see other champions' heath bars.
The only warning that crit gives is that it's more likely to occur every time it doesn't. That doesn't help you know when it *is* going to occur though.

However, this is a problem with crit chance in general. Trynd's problem is that he is entirely reliant on it.

> [{quoted}](name=Ariel the Cruel,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WRlwbN12,comment-id=000400000000000000000002,timestamp=2016-11-26T08:34:17.209+0000)
>
> You can see when a champion takes minion aggro. You can also see other champions' heath bars.
> The only warning that crit gives is that it's more likely to occur every time it doesn't. That doesn't help you know when it *is* going to occur though.

There is more warning than that.  You can see his fury bar.  You can manipulate his fury bar through playing back at it.  I can take advantages based upon that.  I can gain experience about the match-up.  I can learn when his window's of opportunity are and when mine are in that match-up.  I can learn when he has advantageous trades and when I do.  And you can do all this with crit chance.

Anybody can list out an aspect of a champion and act like it is grossly unfair. But if a player doesn't know when trades are favorable for one or the other or underestimates the potential damage of a trade or all-in, that's a misplay.  I could complain that (old) LeBlanc jumps on me as Lux and removes my health without warning and that's unfair, maybe toss in the words "mobility creep" to get people to agree with me.  Or I could complain that Lux hits me as LeBlanc with damage from across the lane and that I go oom if I trade back, maybe toss in "power creep" to get people to agree with me when I get hit with a combo while hanging around when I'm in kill range.  But I would rather play both and learn the match-up.

Other people don't.  I've seen Tryndamere threads on here; 70% of them are "He keeps splitpushing! He can't do that!" as if it is against the rules to not "group up" and then ARAM mid all game, and the 30% are slightly more sophisticated, and mentions his crit chance, unfortunately, usually in the terms of he crits from nowhere and that's toxic and unfair.
Well no, it doesn't; it comes from his fury bar which we spent the last thirty seconds watching him constantly AA the minion wave to build up, and it's the other guy's fault for not doing anything before or after this.  So let's not say it there is no warning.

> However, this is a problem with crit chance in general. Trynd's problem is that he is entirely reliant on it.

That's not true.  If Tryndamere really is entirely reliant on lucky crits, like the threads say, or entirely reliant on crit chance in general, why do the top Tryndamere players keep building things like Ravenous Hydra, Blade of the Ruined King, and Black Cleaver?  Shouldn't they be rushing IE and 100% crit if he is entirely reliant criting?
Tryndamere is reliant on pressuring the map which low elo players suck at dealing with and that explains the threads we get for certain champions.

Tryndamere gains 0.35% crit chance per point of fury - maxing out at 35%.
With even 1 point of fury, Tryndamere has the potential to crit. The RNG nature of crit means he also has the potential to crit multiple times. With a full bar he is *more likely* but is not guaranteed to crit. That's the heart of the problem.
LB has cooldowns and mana costs. [Old] LB's burst came out fast, but you at least knew when it couldn't happen. Crit doesn't have that luxury. So long as there is *any* crit chance, *every* AA can crit at any time. It's not something you can play around, you can only pray to RNGesus.

>. . .top Tryndamere players. . .

I don't pay attention to high elo streams (or streams in general) to see what they do. If I were to guess:
Cleaver/BotRK: Tanks are the most likely to intercept him. Those items counter defense stats.
Hydra: Improved wave-clear for his split-push shenanigans. 
No IE: Critting every (Statistical average) 3ed AA is still quite a bit, and crits don't proc on structures (Jhin excluded).

>70% of them are "He keeps splitpushing! He can't do that!" 

I never said anything about split-pushing. It's annoying, not problematic.
Last I checked that is playing to a champ's strengths.

Exactly, that is playing to a champion's strength.

You can do this with anyone. Anybody can list out some strength and act like it is grossly unfair.  For bonus points, they can do things like call it "toxic" (that word is popular nowadays) or make up contrived scenarios that are impossible to do anything about because they said so.

You play {{champion:39}}, you know that people do this.  So I believe you are informed enough to recognize the pattern and know when people are doing this about another champion and how bullshit it is.
